input_text:
Job Title: Wealth Manager

Location: Seattle, WA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Management

Description:
Compensation - $100,000 - $130,000 base salary plus bonuses and benefits
The Wealth Manager role is an integral part of the team serving as the true connection between clients, support team, and Wealth Managers. This great communicator, influencer and enthusiastic person will support our client's culture, vision, and team spirit are built upon their values which are:Grace & EmpathyGenerosity & GratitudePassion & ExcellenceIntegrity & PrideThey focus on these values in how they act, what they do, and how they serve clients.
The Wealth Manager provides comprehensive technical financial planning and investmentmanagement work, either, under the management of higher-level professionals or on their own.They work with clients and are under the supervision of a Managing Director and have decision making abilities on client plans, investment processes and procedures, operational processes and procedures and client affairs.
A Wealth Manager is responsible for conducting client meetings as well as supporting both theManaging Director and Vice President - Wealth Manager. The Wealth Manager will work with other advisory team members and staff members as needed to discuss client cases. They have obtained the proper licensing and experience to work directly with clients.
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Client and Advisory EngagementWorks directly with assigned clients to best support their financial planning, investmentmanagement, and risk outcomes. Engages directly with clients and is responsible for retention, growth, and support of clients.Focus on maintaining above 90% client retention and target engagement for growth opportunities.Accountable for client relationships managed and client process within the Wealth Manager responsibilities including delivery of the TAG Client Experience.The Wealth Manager utilizes planning tools, as well as internal and external resources, all in pursuit of helping clients achieve their goals as well as supporting both the Managing Director and Vice President Wealth Manager.Understands client needs by identifying and confirming their objectives, goals, and concerns.Reviews client profiles and investment portfolios at an appropriate frequency to ensure all needs and actions have been met and to identify gaps in their planning.Analyzes information and evaluates results to choose the best solution to solve client or operational problems, while being accountable for those decisions.Works closely with both the Managing Director and Vice President - Wealth Manager to develop advanced planning expertise.Analyzes client information and evaluates results to choose the best financial planning solution within the Transformational Advisory Group client experience process.Build out client financial plans and investment proposals as directed by the Managing Director and Vice President – Wealth Manager.Works with-in a team structure that is designed for growth and supports the success of the team and overall organization.
ComplianceComplies with all regulatory requirements.Brings any compliance or ethics concerns to management’s attention and Completes all Firm and FINRA educational requirements on time.
Experience and EducationBachelor’s degree preferredCFP® required or similar designation approvedSeries 7, 66, & Life/Health Insurance License3-8 years direct advisory focusProficient in core financial planning and proficient of core client case
Skills and KnowledgeExcellent communication skills (verbal, written and listening)Proficient in financial planning, analysis, and modelingProficient in Microsoft Office Suite requiredKnowledge of investment advisory regulations requiredDemonstrates personal integrity, honesty, and can deal with confidential informationAbility to deal with stress in an ever-changing investment market and financial services industryExcellent time management and organizational skills, and the ability to prioritize multiple tasks and anticipate potential problems
Compensation $100,000 - $130,000 base salary plus bonuses and benefits

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Wealth Manager
output_json.summary: The Wealth Manager role is an integral part of the team serving as the true connection between clients, support team, and Wealth Managers.
job_responsibilities: Works directly with assigned clients to best support their financial planning, investment management, and risk outcomes.
Engages directly with clients and is responsible for retention, growth, and support of clients.
Accountable for client relationships managed and client process within the Wealth Manager responsibilities including delivery of the TAG Client Experience.

Utilizes planning tools, as well as internal and external resources, all in pursuit of helping clients achieve their goals as well as supporting both the Managing Director and Vice President Wealth Manager.
Understands client needs by identifying and confirming their objectives, goals, and concerns.
Reviews client profiles and investment portfolios at an appropriate frequency to ensure all needs and actions have been met and to identify gaps in their planning.
Analyzes information and evaluates results to choose the best solution to solve client or operational problems, while being accountable for those decisions.
Works closely with both the Managing Director and Vice President - Wealth Manager to develop advanced planning expertise.
Analyzes client information and evaluates results to choose the best financial planning solution within the Transformational Advisory Group client experience process.
Builds out client financial plans and investment proposals as directed by the Managing Director and Vice President – Wealth Manager.
Works within a team structure that is designed for growth and supports the success of the team and overall organization.
benefits: $100,000 - $130,000 base salary plus bonuses and benefits
